ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It has quite some stuff same as 570 Artificial Intelligence. If you are not super interested in Robotics and you have already taken 570, then there is not much sense in taking 573.
CS 573 is an interesting course which will help you build the foundation if you want to take advanced courses in robotics
Yeah, I strongly recommend this course to students who want to explore the field of artificial intelligence or intelligent robotics.
An overview of robot control and implementation technologies. Well taught and highly recommended.
Would recommend this over Artifical Intelligence (570) as an intro course to AI
I would definitely recommend it to another student. Robotics is a growing field and it is essential to know for any engineer.

Yes. This course may not be very related to students who do not want to pursue further in the field of robotics. However, this whole process of designing and conducting a robotics-related or social science related project is highly beneficial.
Would probably recommend it if you're interested.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It leads me further into the robotics&AI world. I learnt the structure design of different robots, quite cool and interesting.
Very helpful for general knowledge; will definitely help with progression of research.
